title: Digital Hitlist 2012.04.09
description:
Q: What the hell?

A: In the immortal words of <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipJ" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipJ</a>  :
   
      "Hitlist = everything scanned bar the 0days"
   
   Now, as you may or may not know, digital releases first appeared in October 2011 
   or thereabouts, while the Hitlist Weeklies only started in April 2012, leaving a 
   "gap" during which many re-releases of older comics weren't made widely available.
   
   Fortunately, I now have means, motive, and opportunity to do something about that!
   
   The means being release listings covering at least part of said interval, which I 
   chanced upon earlier today, the motive being, of course, my trusty OCD, and the 
   opportunity being the continued existence of our cherished PirateBay (*applause*)!
   
   I'm setting the bar a bit lower for myself, though: Rather than "everything 
   scanned", these torrents are going to be constructed along the lines of "most 
   things digitally ripped which I managed to track down" - good enough, I daresay?

RELEASE ORDER: Working backwards from the end of the "gap", meaning from 2012-04-10.
HOWEVER:       That day turned out to have exactly zero eligible releases, so April 9
               gets the inaugural spot instead. Two days down, hundreds more to go!

RELEASE SCHEDULE: Um. Somewhere between "daily" and "wildly irregular", I expect...
